security: This document discusses specific files held by the CIA on Lee Harvey Oswald, including 201 files, HTLINGUAL files, and Office of Security files. Releasing details about these specific files could reveal the CIA's methods for tracking individuals and managing information, which would harm intelligence operations. Quoting the request: 'Please identify, as specifically as possible, each file held by CIA on Oswald at the time of the assassination of President Kennedy.'
summary: A letter from the Assassination Records Review Board to the CIA requesting additional information and records related to Lee Harvey Oswald's pre-assassination files.
summary_one_paragraph: In a letter dated January 28, 1997, the Assassination Records Review Board, under Executive Director David G. Marwell, requests Director John Pereira of the CIA's Historical Review Group to provide comprehensive answers regarding the files held by the CIA on Lee Harvey Oswald before President Kennedy's assassination. The Board seeks to identify each file, explain when and why the files were opened, and detail the documents they contained, particularly concerning a 201 file, an HTLINGUAL file, and an Office of Security file. The letter, referencing Director Robert M. Gates' earlier testimony, also asks about pre-assassination files maintained by Counterintelligence and the Office of Security and requests information about any destroyed records, with a response deadline of February 24, 1997.
tags: JFK Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992
title: Request for Additional Information and Records No. CIA-16 (Oswald Pre-Assassination Files)
sender: David G. Marwell (Executive Director, Assassination Records Review Board)
